welcomeMessage: Welcome to SNJB COE Assistant! I'm your comprehensive AI guide for SNJB's Late Sau Kantabai Bhavarlalji Jain College of Engineering. I can help you with detailed information about admissions, academics, campus life, placements, and much more!

topicsInfo.about: SNJB's Late Sau Kantabai Bhavarlalji Jain College of Engineering is a prestigious institution established in 2004, located in the Jain Gurukul campus in Chandwad. The college is approved by AICTE New Delhi and Government of Maharashtra, and affiliated to Savitribai Phule Pune University (formerly University of Pune). Starting with four engineering branches, the college has grown to include MBA (2010) and Artificial Intelligence & Data Science (2020). The institution is known for its excellent infrastructure, well-equipped laboratories, and strong placement record.
topicsInfo.history: SNJB COE was established in 2004 with four core engineering branches: Mechanical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electronics & Telecommunications Engineering, and Civil Engineering. In 2010, the college expanded by adding MBA program under its umbrella. The latest addition came in 2020 with the establishment of Artificial Intelligence and Data Science department, keeping pace with modern technological demands.
topicsInfo.admissions: Admissions at SNJB COE are conducted through the DTE Maharashtra Centralized Admission Process (CAP). For First Year Engineering (F.E.), candidates must have passed 12th Science with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics (PCM) group and qualify MHT-CET or JEE Main. For Direct Second Year (D.S.E./Lateral Entry), students should have completed a diploma in engineering with at least 45% marks (40% for reserved categories). The college follows Maharashtra state reservation policy. Admission portal and detailed brochure are available on the official website.
topicsInfo.programs:
SNJB COE offers comprehensive programs across multiple disciplines:

**Undergraduate Programs (B.E. - 4 Years):**
‚Ä¢ Civil Engineering (60 seats)
‚Ä¢ Computer Engineering (120 seats)
‚Ä¢ Mechanical Engineering (60 seats)
‚Ä¢ Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering (60 seats)
‚Ä¢ Artificial Intelligence & Data Science (60 seats)

**Postgraduate Programs:**
‚Ä¢ Master of Business Administration (MBA) - 2 Years (60 seats)
‚Ä¢ M.Tech in Computer Engineering (18 seats)

**First Year Engineering:** All students undergo a common first-year curriculum to build strong foundational knowledge in engineering fundamentals.
topicsInfo.departments:
SNJB COE has well-established departments with experienced faculty and modern infrastructure:

**Civil Engineering Department:**
‚Ä¢ Head: Dr. A. Sharma
‚Ä¢ Focus: Structural Engineering, Environmental Engineering, Transportation, Geotechnical Engineering
‚Ä¢ Labs: Concrete Testing, Soil Mechanics, Survey, CAD Lab

**Computer Engineering Department:**
‚Ä¢ Head: Prof. B. Patil
‚Ä¢ Focus: Software Development, AI/ML, Data Science, Cybersecurity
‚Ä¢ Labs: Programming, Database, Networking, Project Lab

**Mechanical Engineering Department:**
‚Ä¢ Head: Dr. C. Pawar
‚Ä¢ Focus: Manufacturing, Thermal Engineering, Design, Automation
‚Ä¢ Labs: Workshop, Thermal, Fluid Mechanics, CAD/CAM

**Electronics & Telecommunication Department:**
‚Ä¢ Head: Prof. D. Jadhav
‚Ä¢ Focus: Communication Systems, VLSI, Embedded Systems, Signal Processing
‚Ä¢ Labs: Communication, Microprocessor, VLSI, Project Lab

**Artificial Intelligence & Data Science Department:**
‚Ä¢ Head: Prof. E. More

‚Ä¢ Labs: AI/ML Lab, Data Science Lab, IoT Lab

**MBA Department:**
‚Ä¢ Head: Dr. F. Desai

topicsInfo.vision:
**Vision:**
To transform young aspirant learners into creative professionals who contribute to societal development through quality technical education, ethical values, leadership skills, and innovation-driven thinking.

**Mission:**
To provide quality technical education with emphasis on:
‚Ä¢ Practical learning and hands-on experience
‚Ä¢ Research and innovation in emerging technologies
‚Ä¢ Industry-academia collaboration
‚Ä¢ Holistic personality development
‚Ä¢ Ethical and moral values
‚Ä¢ Global competitiveness and employability

**Goals and Objectives:**
‚Ä¢ Excellence in technical education and research
‚Ä¢ Development of competent engineers and managers
‚Ä¢ Promotion of innovation and entrepreneurship
‚Ä¢ Service to society through knowledge and skills
‚Ä¢ Sustainable development and environmental consciousness
‚Ä¢ Character building and leadership development
